steps.title: Go to a Lutheran church and ask the pastor about membership.
steps.content: Go to a Lutheran church and ask the pastor about membership.

steps.title: The pastor will usually offer to take you through a Bible Instruction Class or meet with you to discuss the differences between Lutherans and other Christians.
steps.content: The pastor will usually offer to take you through a Bible Instruction Class or meet with you to discuss the differences between Lutherans and other Christians.

steps.title: After the class you are welcome to be a Lutheran member!
steps.content: After the class you are welcome to be a Lutheran member!

steps.title: Keep reading the Bible to grow your faith.
steps.content: Keep reading the Bible to grow your faith. Honestly believing the Bible isn't something that magically happens when you join a Lutheran church. It might take a while, but through reading the Bible and prayer, God can create real faith in your heart.

steps.title: Read the Small Catechism.
steps.content: Read the Small Catechism. You may consider reading the Small Catechism of Dr.Martin Luther to further understand what Lutherans really believes.

steps.title: Try to read the Book of Concord.
steps.content: Try to read the Book of Concord. This is the testimony and confession of faith of early followers of the reform of Luther.
